section.title: Introduction
section.t: Many Network Service Providers (NSPs) are currently considering or have already started to deploy Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) within their networks. As a consequence of this development, there is a need for interconnecting these local CDNs. Content Delivery Networks Interconnection (CDNI) has the goal of standardizing protocols to enable such interconnection of CDNs .

The CDNI problem statement defines four interfaces to be standardized within the IETF for CDN interconnection:
CDNI Request Routing Interface CDNI Metadata Interface CDNI Logging Interface CDNI Control Interface

This document focuses solely on CDNI FCI, with a goal to specify a new Application-Layer Traffic Optimization (ALTO) service called "CDNI FCI Map Service", to transport and update CDNI FCI objects, which are defined in a separate document in and to describe approaches for filtering CDNI FCI map on capabilities or footprints.
Throughout this document, we use the terminology for CDNI defined in and .
